Package photopack

Class Album

java.lang.Object
photopack.Album
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Album extends Object implements Serializable
The "Album" class represents a collection of photos stored in an ArrayList. It implements the Serializable interface and contains methods to add, delete, and check for duplicate photos. It also has methods to retrieve and modify the name of the album and its photo collection.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Album

      public Album(String name, ArrayList<Photo> photo)
      This constructor creates a new Album object with a specified name and an ArrayList of Photo objects representing its collection of photos. The "name" parameter represents the name of the album, and the "photo" parameter represents the collection of photos in the album. This constructor initializes the "album" and "name" instance variables with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the album
      photo - an ArrayList of Photo objects to be added to the album

    • Album

      public Album(String name)
      This constructor creates a new Album object with a specified name. The "name" parameter represents the name of the album. This constructor initializes an empty ArrayList for the "album" instance variable and sets the "name" instance variable to the provided parameter.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the album

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      This method sets the name of the Album object. The "name" parameter represents the new name for the album. It updates the "name" instance variable with the provided parameter.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name of the album

    • getName

      public String getName()
      This method retrieves the name of the Album object. It returns the current value of the "name" instance variable.
      Returns:
      the name of the album

    • setAlbum

      public void setAlbum(ArrayList<Photo> photo)
      This method sets the collection of photos for the Album object. The "photo" parameter represents the new ArrayList of Photo objects to be set as the album's collection of photos. It updates the "album" instance variable with the provided parameter.
      Parameters:
      photo - the ArrayList of Photo objects to set as the new album list

    • getAlbum

      public ArrayList<Photo> getAlbum()
      This method retrieves the collection of photos of the Album object. It returns the current value of the "album" instance variable, which is an ArrayList of Photo objects representing the collection of photos in the album.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of Photo objects in the album

    • addPhoto

      public void addPhoto(Photo photo)
      This method adds a new Photo object to the collection of photos in the Album object. The "photo" parameter represents the new Photo object to be added to the album's collection of photos. It adds the provided Photo object to the "album" ArrayList instance variable.
      Parameters:
      photo - the Photo object to add to the album list

    • deletePhoto

      public void deletePhoto(Photo photo)
      This method removes a specific Photo object from the collection of photos in the Album object. The "photo" parameter represents the Photo object to be removed from the album's collection of photos. It searches through the "album" ArrayList instance variable for the provided Photo object and removes it from the collection if it is found.
      Parameters:
      photo - the Photo object to remove from the album list

    • duplicate

      public boolean duplicate(String str)
      This method checks whether the album's collection of photos contains a Photo object with a specific caption. The "str" parameter represents the caption to be searched for. It searches through the "album" ArrayList instance variable for a Photo object with a matching caption and returns true if found, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      str - the caption to search for
      Returns:
      true if a photo with the given caption exists in the album, false otherwise

    • duplicatePhoto

      public boolean duplicatePhoto(Photo photo)
      This method checks whether the album's collection of photos contains a specific Photo object. The "photo" parameter represents the Photo object to be searched for. It searches through the "album" ArrayList instance variable for the provided Photo object and returns true if found, otherwise false.
      Parameters:
      photo - the Photo object to search for
      Returns:
      true if the given photo exists in the album, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This method returns a string representation of the Album object. It includes the name of the album, the number of photos in its collection, and the earliest and latest dates of the photos. If the album's collection of photos is empty, it returns a string with only the album's name and the number of photos.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
